title: Ticket #2138: [Debian] Disable scimark
description: There are no sources of the scimark jar shipped with condor. Debian maintainer needs to figure out whether it is worth packaging that separately, but the project seems to be rather dead.
remarks:
2011-Dec-20 10:30:22 by jfrey:
Is it sufficient to include the source of the scimark JAR file? Or does the build process need to generate the jar from the source?

2011-Dec-20 12:14:59 by bbockelm:
I don't know about debian, but from the Fedora POV, this won't fly:
  • Separate project should be in a separate package. Maintainer might have a touch of difficulty getting it approved as it appears to have died off 11 years ago. In Fedora, I believe the preference is to do this rather than bundle: http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Packaging:No_Bundled_Libraries.
  • Any artifacts in the RPM must be built from source. This explicitly includes Java JAR files. So, you can't include the binary JAR plus sources; it must be rebuilt. http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Packaging:Guidelines#No_inclusion_of_pre-built_binaries_or_libraries

2011-Dec-20 13:43:24 by mih:
This applies one-to-one to Debian as well. Just the links point to different wiki pages ;-)

2011-Dec-22 08:00:43 by matt:
scimark2 is public domain, and only used to generate JavaMFlops. It can be safely removed, with no code changes, so long as JAVA_BENCHMARK_TIME=0 in configuration.
check_ins: 2011-Dec-22 07:56   Check-in [28894]: Fixed JAVA_BENCHMARK_TIME default, was 2 should be 0 (as per param call site), note condor_config.generic defines JAVA_BENCHMARK_TIME=2 (By Matthew Farrellee )
